personal.name: Chaitya Wasnik
personal.tagline: Building performant, scalable full-stack applications that solve real problems.

highlights: Developed a cross-platform (iOS & Android) carousel component using ReactJS and React Native to display ongoing orders, repairs, and appointments.
Engineered Java Spring Boot APIs using GraphQL to integrate with Assurant’s third-party insurance APIs, providing real-time visibility of active claims.
Built a Java Spring Boot microservice that consumes repair events from Kafka, persists data to GCP, and exposes it via REST APIs for status tracking.
Consolidated support experience by enhancing /support and /customer/devices pages, providing a unified view of devices and streamlined support access.
Enabled self-service features that save $112,000 annually in operational costs by reducing customer support call volume.
Architected scalable REST APIs and built Codex — a centralized React dashboard for network operations
Integrated OAuth2 SSO (ForgeRock) and implemented real-time WebSocket feedback pipelines
Designed event-driven workflows with Kafka and created the Catalyst Orchestrator for network monitoring
Automated storage provisioning and failover mechanisms, saving ~$120,000 in operational costs
Implemented Redis caching reducing API response times from 600ms to 20ms
Managed client revenue data analysis and built optimized Business Objects reports
Fixed process chain failures and reduced downtime by over 30%
Optimized monitoring workflows for real-time system health tracking
Developed custom ABAP programs to automate repetitive data processing tasks

projects.title: E-Commerce Microservices
projects.description: A distributed e-commerce platform built with microservices architecture featuring service discovery, centralized configuration, and event-driven workflows.

projects.title: Spring Blog API
projects.description: A comprehensive backend for a blog application with user authentication, profile management, and secure JWT-based API endpoints.

projects.title: Swiggy-clone (QEats)
projects.description: A distributed Java backend for a food ordering app featuring Spring Boot, MongoDB for data persistence, and Redis for performance optimization.

projects.title: Legacy Reconciler DOM
projects.description: A custom Virtual DOM diffing and reconciliation algorithm implementation showcasing deep understanding of frontend rendering engines.

projects.title: Adaptive Support Router
projects.description: GraphQL-based integration service at Best Buy that connects internal systems with third-party insurance APIs for real-time insurance claims.

projects.title: Repair Vault Consumer
projects.description: High-throughput service at Best Buy that processes repair events via Kafka and persists state to GCP for customer tracking.

projects.title: Codex
projects.description: A centralized React dashboard for executing network scripts at Lowe's, reducing manual work by an average of 3 days per task.

projects.title: Catalyst Orchestrator
projects.description: Event-driven workflow engine for real-time provisioning and monitoring of network devices using Kafka, Grafana, and Prometheus.

projects.title: Cross-Platform Carousel
projects.description: A unified carousel component for Best Buy's web and mobile platforms used for tracking orders and repairs with consistent UX.

openSource.description: Contributed to the leading open-source headless CMS — a backend used by thousands of developers worldwide.
Contributed to the open-source scheduling infrastructure used widely for calendar management.
Contributed to a community-driven open-source travel application.
